_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm and shut-off at 85% tank capacity, Class I/Division 2 electrical radius extended to 25 ft, pneumatic ESV's with fire protection.
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon Detectors, Temperature, Pressure and Flow Detectors

_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane Blending System involving injection into gasoline pipelines (injection performed at Kinder Morgan's and Motiva Enterprise's Facilities), and bulk truck and rail offloading systems.

_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: Knox County LEPC and Knoxville FD
_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: Tennessee Department of Commerce and Insurance Liquefied Petroleum Gas Codes

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals, LLC (KMST) - Knoxville Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the Butane Blending System, including the associated piping and butane storage vessels.  KMST owns the real property associated with the Butane Blending System.  Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC (Sunoco) owns all the equipment associated with the Butane Blending System.  Sunoco and KMST each have operational responsibilities for the Butane Blending System.   Sunoco controls and monitors all butane blending operations remotely from its control center located near Houston, Texas, conducts all maintenance activities, and schedules the delivery of butane trucks and railcars.  KMST oversees the unloading of butane trucks and railcars into both storage vessels and conducts routine visual inspections.



Sunoco constructed the Butane Blending System in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) No. 58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage.  Sunoco designed, constructed, and maintains the Butane Blending System, in accordance with NFPA No. 58 and the manufacturer's instructions and recommendations.



It is the Parties' policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the Parties' policy to notify the Knoxville Fire Department as well as the Knox County Emergency Management Agency.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services and the University of Tennessee Medical Center, which is the nearest full service hospital/emergency department.



The Parties comply with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicabl

e state and local laws and regulations.  This facility has not had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Butane Blending System, it is the Parties' policy to initially contact the owner of the equipment - Sunoco and the local fire department.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the local fire department.  The Knoxville Fire Department personnel have participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.  Additional vessel protection includes an intumescent coating.  Note: In contrast to the PSM requirements, this "stationary source" as defined under 40 CFR Part 68 is bounded by the off-load station and the points of injection. 



The Parties actively seek employee input on process safety improvements.  Additionally, the Knoxville Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
